comments:
While creating a new project:

New Java Project
at the third screen ("Java Settings") there's a textbox labelled "Build output 
folder." It contains "/Project"
Append the following characters: "/../"
Error dialog appears: 
---------
An internal error has occurred. org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree
See error log for more details.
---------

Note that the dialog didn't tell me where to find the error log; I had to hunt 
for it myself.

Here's the relevant entry from the error log:

Fixed, tested and released.

The problem is that new Path("/a/../) actually created an illegal path instance. 
The resulting path had both a leading and trailing separator, but no segments.  
The ElementTree code failed to handle the deviant path instance which resulted 
in the failure (isRoot() returned false instead of true).  The fix is in 
Path#canonicalize.
